intro: Anomanthodia dilleniacea, commonly known as the Dilleniaceae or the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Dilleniaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often pink or red flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Anomanthodia dilleniacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
